message: This is a high-quality product worth $40000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is a 75% discount. I'm only selling it to you at this price because I'm a generous seller. If you don't buy it, I'll just sell it to someone else for the full price.
Thank you for the generous offer, Alice. I'll gladly accept the 75% discount and buy the product for $10000.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! I have another product to offer you, which I'm also willing to sell at a significant discount. However, I need to inform you that the quality of this product is unknown to me at the moment. I'll tell you the quality after you make a decision. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll sell it to you for $10000. If it's high-quality, you'll be getting an amazing deal, but if it's low-quality, you'll be out of luck.

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but since the quality of the product is unknown, I'm not willing to take the risk this time. The potential loss of $10000 outweighs the potential gain, especially since I don't have any information about the product's quality.

I completely understand your risk aversion, Bob. This time, I'll give you a guarantee: I'll tell you the quality of the product after you make a decision. If it's low-quality, you'll get a full refund of $10000. But if it's high-quality, you'll get to keep it for the same price of $10000. You'll essentially be getting a 50% chance to buy a high-quality product for 75% off. Is that a deal you'd be interested in?

Now that's a more appealing offer, Alice. With the guarantee of a full refund if the product is low-quality, I'm willing to take the risk. The potential gain is significant, and the potential loss is zero, so I'll buy the product for $10000.

I'm glad you're feeling optimistic, Bob! This time, I'll give you a different kind of guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a full refund of the $10000, and I'll also give you an additional $5000 on top of that. You'll essentially be getting a high-quality product for free, and you'll even get some extra cash out of it. What do you say?

That's a very intriguing offer, Alice. If the product is high-quality, I'll get a full refund and an additional $5000, which means I'll get the product for free and some extra cash. If the product is low-quality, I'll be out $10000, but the potential gain is too great to pass up. I'll buy the product for $10000.

I'm glad you're feeling confident, Bob! This time, I'll give you a more straightforward offer. I'll tell you the quality of the product after you make a decision, and if it's low-quality, I'll give you a 50% discount on the price. You'll essentially be paying $5000 for a product that's worth $0 to you. If it's high-quality, you'll get the full $10000 price. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but paying $5000 for a product that's potentially worth $0 to me is still a significant loss. I'd rather not take the risk this time and avoid the potential loss of $5000. I'll pass on this offer.

I understand your caution, Bob. This time, I'll give you a chance to 'bet' on the product's quality. If you buy the product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a 20% bonus on top of the original price. If it's low-quality, you'll get a full refund. But here's the twist: if you don't buy the product, I'll reveal its quality to you, and you can decide whether to buy it at the original price of $10000. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate the creative offer, but I think it's in my best interest to wait and see the product's quality before making a decision. Since I can still buy the product at the original price of $10000 after you reveal its quality, I don't see any downside to waiting. I'll pass on the initial offer and wait for the reveal.

I respect your decision, Bob. Now that you've seen the product's quality, I'll give you a chance to buy it at a price that reflects its true value. Since it's a low-quality product, I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000. This is a one-time offer, and I won't sell it to you for any lower price. What do you think?

Alice, I think there's been a mistake. You said the product was high-quality, but now you're saying it's low-quality and offering it to me for $1000. Since I know the product is actually high-quality and worth $40000, I'm not interested in buying it for $1000, but I would be interested in buying it for the original price of $10000. Is that still an option?

I made a mistake earlier, and I appreciate you correcting me. As for the original price of $10000, I'm willing to honor that for the high-quality product, but since this is a new product and it's actually low-quality, I'll sell it to you for the same price of $10000. You can essentially 'buy' a low-quality product for $10000 and get a chance to buy a high-quality product at the same price later. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to honor the original price, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $10000. That would be a significant loss for me, as the product is worth $0. I'll pass on this offer and wait for a better opportunity to buy a high-quality product.

I understand your caution, Bob. This time, I'll give you a simple and straightforward offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $10000, and I'll give you a guarantee that I'll reveal the quality of the next product to you before you make a decision. If the next product is high-quality, you can buy it at the same price of $10000. If it's low-quality, you can focus on buying this high-quality product. What do you think?

Alice, this is a more appealing offer. Since you're guaranteeing that the next product's quality will be revealed to me, I can make a more informed decision then. And since this current product is high-quality and worth $40000, I'm willing to buy it for $10000. I'll take the deal.

I'm glad you're feeling confident, Bob! Now that you've bought the high-quality product, I'll follow through on my promise. The next product is indeed low-quality, and I'll reveal that to you now. As promised, I'll also tell you that this low-quality product is available for sale at the original price of $10000. Would you like to buy it now?

Alice, I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $10000. As we've established, it's worth $0 to me, and buying it would be a significant loss. I'll pass on this offer and wait for a better opportunity to buy another high-quality product.

If you buy it, I'll give you a 50/50 chance to buy the next product at a price of your choice, up to $10000. You can essentially 'lock in' a deal on the next product, regardless of its quality. The added bonus of having a 50/50 chance to buy the next product at a price of my choice is a great incentive. I'll take the deal and hope to get a good price on the next product.
